name: Cheesy Chicken and Broccoli Rice Casserole
description: ALWAYS A WINNER! Can be made ahead of time, and leftovers taste even better! So cheesy, comforting and hearty!
recipeIngredient: 1  (6-ounce) package long-grain and wild rice mix
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

recipeInstructions.text: Cook rice according to package instructions; set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook rice according to package instructions; set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Melt butter in a large oven-proof skillet over medium high heat. Add garlic, onion, mushrooms and celery. Cook, stirring occasionally, until tender, about 3-4 minutes. Stir in thyme until fragrant, about 1 minute.
recipeInstructions.name: Melt butter in a large oven-proof skillet over medium high heat. Add garlic, onion, mushrooms and celery. Cook, stirring occasionally, until tender, about 3-4 minutes. Stir in thyme until fragrant, about 1 minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk in flour until lightly browned, about 1 minute. Gradually whisk in wine and chicken stock. Cook, whisking constantly, until slightly thickened, about 2-3 minutes; season with salt and pepper, to taste.
recipeInstructions.name: Whisk in flour until lightly browned, about 1 minute. Gradually whisk in wine and chicken stock. Cook, whisking constantly, until slightly thickened, about 2-3 minutes; season with salt and pepper, to taste.

recipeInstructions.text: Stir in broccoli, sour cream, chicken, 3/4 cup cheese and rice. Sprinkle with remaining 3/4 cup cheese.
recipeInstructions.name: Stir in broccoli, sour cream, chicken, 3/4 cup cheese and rice. Sprinkle with remaining 3/4 cup cheese.

recipeInstructions.text: Place into oven and bake until bubbly and heated through, about 20-22 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Place into oven and bake until bubbly and heated through, about 20-22 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve immediately, garnished with parsley, if desired.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve immediately, garnished with parsley, if desired.

review.reviewBody: I made this tonight , but I pressure cooked 2 large chicken breast’s while I was cutting the veg and prepping the other ingredients .. then shredded the chicken and added …WOW it was soooooo good !!
Made this!  The bomb!  We could not get enough!  It is now in our fave club!  Thank you!
This is one of my absolute favorites to make for dinner during the week! And the leftovers always taste just as good.
I made the recipe tonight. I ended up adding more mushrooms and a little bit more cheese. It was amazing!  Even my daughter, who is very picky, loved it.
This is one of my favorite recipes! I never have wild rice so I just use regular rice. Sometimes I sub cauliflower for thr broccoli
This is a winner!  Great flavor combination.  Thanks for sharing!
I got some wind in my sails tonight and made this recipe.  It is beyond what I imagined and incredibly yummy!  I will most definitely be making it again... thank you!
